text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Meeting of Bosnia's government employees' union in Sarajevo on November 22-23 will aim to gather representatives of the country's Moslem-Croat federation and Serb republic. Dubbed "Congress of Transformation", it will fight to ensure government jobs for personnel regardless of policy changes, organisors said.

- Next session of Bosnia's three-man presidency to be held on Friday in Serb territory outside of Sarajevo and is expected to discuss the structure of the country's council of ministers, newspaper says.

- Until the international community applies the same approach in implementing civilian aspects of Bosnia's peace accord as it did in military aspects -- consistency and sanctions for non-compliance, there will be no progress, said Prime Minister Hasan Muratovic commenting on achievements of the peace agreement one year after it was signed in Dayton, Ohio.

- Medical workers announce new strikes across Moslem-Croat federation on December 9 unless their demands for pay rise are met, medical union's representatives said. --Sarajevo newsroom, +387-71-663-864.
